format: A data frame with 75 rows and 15 variables.

parameters.unique_pieces: Number of pieces classified as unique in the instruction manual.
parameters.ages: LEGO's recommended ages of children for the set
parameters.amazon_price: Price of the set at Amazon.
parameters.minifigures: Number of LEGO people in the data, if unknown "NA" was recorded.
parameters.size: Size of the lego pieces: Large if safe for small children and Small for older children.
parameters.packaging: Type of packaging: bag, box, etc.
parameters.weight: Weight of the set of LEGOS in pounds and kilograms.
parameters.theme: Set theme: Duplo, City or Friends.
parameters.pieces: Number of pieces in the set.

reference: Peterson, A. D., & Ziegler, L. (2021). Building a multiple linear regression model with LEGO brick data. Journal of Statistics and Data Science Education, 29(3),1-7. doi:10.1080/26939169.2021.1946450
title: Sample of Lego Sets
description:
Description
Data about Lego Sets for sale. Based on JSDSE article by Anna Peterson and Laura Ziegler
Data from their article was scrapped from multiple sources including brickset.com
